column1: 53.0:And when I felt like I was an old cardigan
60.1:You put me on and said I was your favorite
67.2:A friend to all is a friend to none
97.1:And when I felt like I was an old cardigan
105.0:You put me on and said I was your favorite
125.0:To kiss in cars and downtown bars
169.1:But I knew you'd linger like a tattoo kiss
173.1:I knew you'd haunt all of my what-ifs
176.1:The smell of smoke would hang around this long
180.0:'Cause I knew everything when I was young
184.0:I knew I'd curse you for the longest time
191.1:I knew you'd miss me once the thrill expired
195.0:And you'd be standin' in my front porch light
198.2:And I knew you'd come back to me
215.2:And when I felt like I was an old cardigan
223.0:You put me on and said I was your favorite
